thread.title: Former South Adams football coach Kirk Sorg dies at 65
thread.title_full: Former South Adams football coach Kirk Sorg dies at 65

title: Former South Adams football coach Kirk Sorg dies at 65
text:
Former South Adams football coach Kirk Sorg dies at 65 
By Eric Dutkiewicz - 21Alive Kirk Sorg, 1950-2015 October 8, 2015 Updated Oct 8, 2015 at 7:43 PM EDT 
BERNE, Ind. (21Alive) - Hall-of-fame head former South Adams High School football coach Kirk Sorg has died. 
The South Adams athletics department announced on its Facebook page that Sorg died Monday. He was 55 years old. 
Digital Daily – subscribe to our daily newsletter 
"He served his time here on earth well, making a difference not only at this school, but more importantly in the lives of hundreds of men," the post read. 
Sorg was head coach at South Adams for 23 years, winning one regional, four sectionals, and three straight Allen County Athletic Conference championships in a row. 
Prior to South Adams, Sorg was an assistant coach at Goshen High School--his alma mater--and was part of a 1978 state championship team and 1982 state runner-up team. New Sticker on back of the Starfire helmets for tomorrow nights game at Woodlan. RIP Coach Sorg. pic.twitter.com/nMBQpLVSGt — South Adams Football (@southadamsfb) October 8, 2015 
He was inducted into the Indiana Football Hall of Fame in 2008. 
The Starfires will honor Sorg by wearing "KS" decals on the back of their helmets for Friday night's game against Woodlan. 
Funeral services have yet to be announced.   To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required. We respect your privacy and your email will not be visible to others nor will it be added to any email lists. Most Viewed
